content.description: Climb starts on slab and follows a crack system.  It’s the left most climb in gator farm, on the left side of the large boulder.
content.location: This route is on the Gator Farm wall

content.description: This route is a jug haul with a mini-roof.  Super fun.  A bit soft in my opinion.
A technical route with great moves.
content.protection: Bolted with anchors (chains). Be prepared to clean.
content.location: Located on the Gator Farm wall, just to the left (upstream) of the large bolder.

content.description: This route seems harder and headier than it should for the grade.  Bolts feel like they are placed in the middle of cruxes.
content.protection: Bolts to chain anchors.  Shares anchors with Corner.
content.location: This route is at the left-most side of Candy Land wall.  It is left of the boulder pile separating it from the bulk of the Candy Land routes.

content.protection: Bolted with anchors (chains). Be prepared to clean.
content.location: Located on the Candy Land wall.

content.description: An aesthetic route that follows a dihedral crack through a hueco filled section and finishes on a small roof pull.
content.protection: Top rope anchors. This route takes nuts very well but the rock seems soft.
content.location: This route is on the Gator Farm wall

content.description: Slabby, pocketed limestone with a horizontal crack near the top.  Lighter belayers should belay from sloped ledge below first clip.
content.location: This route is on the Fishing Hole wall.

content.description: Great moderate route surrounded by other moderate climbs.
content.protection: Bolted with anchors (chains). Be prepared to clean.
content.location: Located on Candy Land wall. It may be easier to start with right most route and count over until you get your bearings.

content.description: Slabby limestone with large pockets and huecos.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on The Butt wall.  This route is also just right of the access scramble that leads to camp.
This route is on the Gator Farm wall

content.description: Nice Slab route that has a really cool crack pull transition near the top.  Expect a bit of rope drag at the top.
content.location: Left end of Fishing Hole Wall.

content.description: Layback moves to pockets, pinches, and slopers, with pseudo crack moves. All on slight slab.
content.location: This route is on the Gator Farm wall

content.description: Dihedral climb with crux up high in the pockety section.
content.protection: Bolts to Chain Anchors. Shares anchors with Ten-D-nitis.
content.location: This route is on Candy Land wall.  It is left of the boulder pile separating it from the bulk of the Candy Land routes.

content.description: Fun climb if you don't mind the hollow sounding flake. Surrounded by other moderate climbs on the Candy Land wall.
content.protection: Bolted with anchors (chains). Be prepared to clean.
content.location: Right most route on Candy Land wall.

content.description: Great moderate route surrounded by other moderate climbs.
content.protection: Bolted with anchors (chains). Be prepared to clean.
content.location: Towards the middle of Candy Land wall. It's easier to start with right most route and count over.

content.description: The bottom of the route is slabby and thin.  The route has a couple difficult transitional moves into the crack.  The crack itself is a sharp, positive hand crack that lends itself well to layback moves.
content.protection: Chain anchors that are accessible from the top.  The crack will probably take small to medium gear.
content.location: This route is probably the most prominent feature feature on The Butt wall.
This route is on the Fishing Hole wall.

content.description: Emerald Pools contains five walls: Gator Farm, Candy Land, The Butt, Cheap Beer Odyssey and Fishing Hole.  The third class scramble approach from the campground drops in between The Butt and Cheap Beer Odyssey.  Facing the river, it runs right to left, with Gator Farm being the most down stream and Fishing Hole being the furthest up stream.
